rComments: Jesse is a good teacher and is enthusiastic about the subject, but his tests are harder than expected. you need to work fairly hard to get a B. lectures and movies get boring and are somewhat repetitive.

Professor Fankushen is alright. I took his class due to all the high reviews but he seemed a little on the flat, boring side. Maybe it was just the material (which seriously felt like a history class, not a film class). He was nice enough to talk to outside of class and his tests were ok. 2 scantron tests and one research paper made up the grade.

Jesse is an excellent instructor. He has amazing energy and great enthusiasm for what he teaches. He expects students to attend class and participate, but he is easy-going and understanding. I learned a lot of great techniques and information on documentary filmmaking. The class was a thoroughly enjoyable experience!

He's the best. Super clear, down-to-earth, friendly, approachable, funny, and a fantastic speaker. Knew his topics inside and out. There's not much more you can ask for in an instructor! I learned a LOT in this class and had fun doing it. I'd love to take another class with him.

Jesse's a winner. He's really friendly and fun, but not in an "oh-look-how-cool-and-fun-I-am" way. He's just a chill, enthusiastic, slightly awkward guy. Tons of fun to hear lecture. The class was a lot of work, but the work was like, taking pictures & writing & stuff. More fun than work, if you ask me. HOWEVER, he takes roll. :/

Jesse is incredibly charismatic as a speaker. He never talks down to his students, yet is incredibly knowledgeable on film and experienced with documentary work. I could listen to him talk for hours. I can't wait to take another class with him.
